question: 7 (d)
statement_html:
Let P be the projection of all vectors in \(\mathbb{R}^{4}\) into R(A) which is the column space of the matrix

\(\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ -1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 \\ 0 & -2 \end{bmatrix}\).

Let R be the reflection in R(A). Answer the following questions with little or no calculation. You do not need to find the projection and the reflection matrices to answer these questions.

Are P and R invertible? For each invertible transformation among these, find the inverse transformation.
statement_latex:
Let \emph{P} be the projection of all vectors in $\mathbb{R}^{4}$ into
R(A) which is the column space of the matrix

$\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 \\
-1 & 1 \\
1 & 1 \\
0 & -2 
\end{bmatrix}$.

Let R be the reflection in R(A). Answer the following questions with
little or no calculation. You do not need to find the projection and the
reflection matrices to answer these questions.

Are \emph{P} and \emph{R} invertible? For each invertible transformation
among these, find the inverse transformation.
statement_raw:
Let ''P'' be the projection of all vectors in <math> \mathbb{R}^{4} </math> into R(A) which is the column space of the matrix 

<math>
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0 \\
-1 & 1 \\
1 & 1 \\
0 & -2 
\end{bmatrix}
</math>.

Let R be the reflection in R(A). Answer the following questions with little or no calculation. You do not need to find the projection and the reflection matrices to answer these questions.

Are ''P'' and ''R'' invertible? For each invertible transformation among these, find the inverse transformation.
